channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11004] Extend traces through FSHLog#sync
item.description: Changes introduced in HBASE-8755 decouple wal append from wal sync. A gap was left in the tracing of these requests. I believe this means are spans are decoupled from the work happening over on HDFS-5274. This ticket is to close the air-gap between threads.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Yeah. Thanks for filing this Nick Dimiduk Kept meaning to come back and hook it all back up.

Here's an initial patch. It requires a couple tweaks I made to htrace, pull request.

I've verified it works, doesn't leak spans, etc via the included changes to HLogPerfEval. For example this command

./bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.HLogPerformanceEvaluation -Dhbase.trace.spanreceiver.classes=org.htrace.impl.LocalFileSpanReceiver -Dhbase.local-file-span-receiver.path=/tmp/spans.txt -threads 1 -iterations 100 -syncInterval 10

Produces this highly illegible chat, also attached. More convincing, a grep through the spans.txt reports 211 total entries: 100 loop iterations, 100 appends, 10 syncs, and 1 thread. Increasing to 2 threads produces 422 entries of similarly doubled proportions.
FYI, Nicolas Liochon, Elliott Clark, Masatake Iwasaki, Honghua Feng.
On rb: https://reviews.apache.org/r/20453/
I continue to think that we shouldn't include htrace-zipkin as a dependency. Though as more people start using it I could be convinced that I'm wrong.
Nope, you're right. That was unintentional on my part. I added it as a convenience for some local testing. Will remove in the next patch.
Skimmed through the patch, I'm +1 (we need htrace 3.0.4 to be released however
I'm +1 as well as soon as the htrace release is up in maven.
3.0.4 is up now: https://oss.sonatype.org/content/groups/public/org/htrace/htrace/
Rebased to trunk, updated to htrace-3.0.4, removed htrace-zipkin dependency. Same smoke test using HLogPerformanceEvaluation works.
lgtm on skim. Did you pickup the Masatake Iwasaki feedback Mighty Nick Dimiduk?
stack, no, I didn't see any comments from Masatake Iwasaki, was it on another thread? I was sick the last couple days and haven't finished the email pileup yet.

This message is automatically generated.
Definitely related. Taking a look.
Nick Dimiduk no worries. check your rb posting for this patch. He added notes there (looked like good feedback)

I made an incorrect assumption about the disconnected state of a NullSpan instance. This patch corrects the assertions. I've run HLogPerfEval with {{-ea}, with and without tracing enabled, runs fine both ways now. Also ran through smallTests locally, all pass.

I went into parameterizing TestHLogMethods to run with and without a SpanReceiver installed, but the test also passed with patch v1 applied. Aborting that effort for now.
I haven't addressed Masatake Iwasaki's tracing comments yet, see my comments on RB. I'd like to get a clean buildbot run first; additional changes to HLogPerfEval will be cosmetic.

Thanks for checking, Masatake Iwasaki. Will commit after a clean buildbot run.
